channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher; May Remain Rangebound Ahead of Key Econ
item.description: Gold edged higher in early Asian trade. Prices could trade within a narrow range before the release of key U.S. economic data, XS.com said.

item.title: Oil Gains Amid Middle East Tensions
item.description: Oil rose in early Asian trade, after falling recently as Israel steered clear of Iran’s oil and nuclear facilities in attacks over the weekend.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.09% to 99.05
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index rose for the second-consecutive trading day, reaching the highest level since the end of July.

item.title: Ford guides to low end of 2024 earnings forecast as it slightly tops Wall Street's third-quarter expectations
item.description: Ford guides to low end of 2024 earnings forecast as it slightly tops Wall Street's Q3 expectations

item.title: Dexcom shares fall on slow revenue growth
item.description: Dexcom shares fell Thursday after the company released third-quarter results that showed slow revenue growth.

item.title: What to do with Honeywell stock after its sharp post-earnings pullback
item.description: The industrial giant reported mixed third-quarter results compounded by a mixed outlook.

item.title: Barclays shares hit nine-year high after third quarter profit jumps 23%, beating expectations
item.description: British bank Barclays on Thursday reported £1.6 billion ($2 billion) net profit attributable to shareholders for the third quarter, beating expectatio...

item.title: Industrial AI play Dover falls on a noisy quarter. Here's why we'd buy the dip
item.description: Shares of the industrial conglomerate fell more than 3% Thursday.

item.title: Nikkei Slips 0.2%, Dragged by Electronics, Machinery Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks were lower in early trade, dragged by falls in electronics and machinery stocks as domestic political uncertainty continues.

item.title: Oil Prices Slide After Israeli Strike Avoids Iranian Energy Facilities
item.description: U.S. oil futures fell 6.1% Monday, their steepest decline since 2022, after Israel’s strikes on Iran avoided energy facilities. All three major stock ...
